Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with water and show it looking healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant without water and show it looking unhealthy or wilting.
The student can draw patterns in plants that illustrate what happens to them when they receive light and water versus when they do not.
The student can use their drawings to demonstrate that plants need water and light to live and grow.
